flawed_nl_solution:
Darnell would pay 60 / 30 = <<60/30=2>>2 times the $1 texting charge per month.
He would pay 60 / 20 = <<60/20=3>>3 times the $3 call charge per month.
He would pay 2 * 1 + 3 * 3 = 2 + 9 = $<<2*1+3*3=10>>10 per month on the alternative plan.
Thus, Darnell would pay 12 - 10 = $<<12-10=2>>2 less on the alternative plan.
